Name: First Resonance
QuestDesc: As the city lights twinkle, friendly faces beckon you to join them in the bustling border town. Immerse yourself in its prosperous yet tranquil ambiance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here we are. Jinzhou's Nexus Tower!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. Lemme see, uh, think of it as Jinzhou's largest server station, or an integration hub. It's something along those lines. I'm not much of a tech person myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Long story short, it's a navigator, a defense system, and a regional information center all in one enormous package.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The smaller ones we ran into earlier are Resonance Beacons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Data is shared between all Beacons. You activate one, and the entire map's data will be relayed to your Terminal. Pretty nifty, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just place your Terminal here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chixia tells you that the Nexus Tower functions as a navigation, defense, and regional information system. You try connecting your Terminal to the Nexus Tower.

Chapters.Title: Take the elevator to reach the City Hall
Take the elevator to reach the City Hall

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have the arrangements in place. Rover, you can come visit the Magistrate at any time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chixia, do you mind bringing Rover over to the City Hall?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yangyang has made all the necessary arrangements and is waiting for you and Chixia to join her.

Chapters.Title: Check the activated Beacon in the Map view
Take the elevator to reach the City Hall

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whew. First time seeing such a crowd in front of the City Hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was surprised too. I've never seen so many non-staff personnel here before.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are they all here for an audience with the Magistrate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most of the people here have applied for an audience, but I heard they've all been turned down.

Options.PlotLineKey: Perhaps the Magistrate is not here yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most people were advised to leave by the Magistrate's bodyguard upon sending in their applications. The ones staying here are either trying to apply for some other people, or just too stubborn to leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The few that made it inside said it only took "one freezing look from Lady Sanhua", and they were compelled to leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What kind of description is that? Sounds like they've met some snake-haired lady, and got turned into stone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She is the Magistrate's personal bodyguard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I've heard of her before. She's the "All-round Death Glare slash Terminator Ice Beauty."

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...That's what the rumors say, at least.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is the true confidence of our Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I agree though. So far, you've been ticking all the boxes in our Magistrate's description.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is a small chance she's not in the City Hall, but it is very unlikely for her not to be in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or rather, it's nearly impossible for the Magistrate to leave Jinzhou at all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With her busy schedule, it's already difficult to find any time off. In addition, as the Magistrate of Jinzhou, leaving the land under her jurisdiction without authentication is not allowed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unless she's engaged on a business trip, or... when Jinzhou's safety is under threat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yup, there's gotta be something big if that's the case!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure they can.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you thought of something, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: Perhaps the Magistrate did not know who her guest was.
I'm wondering why the Magistrate wanted to meet her guest in person.
She must have a reason for attracting all this attention.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean...?

Options.PlotLineKey: She's not doing this to avoid confusion for her guest.
She should have anticipated the follow-up of her public message.
Still, how does she decide who is her guest, and who is not...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't really keep up with your thoughts, but I think a meeting with the Magistrate wouldn't hurt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Same here. Anyway, our Magistrate's the best lead we have for now, no matter what she has in store for Rover.

Options.PlotLineKey: What if I am not the person?
What if I am the person?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Me? I'm just wondering how to take you, Yangyang, and Baizhi for some chow after this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But my shift's almost coming up. Dunno if we'll make it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't have anything particular in mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was me who... I mean, we took you to Jinzhou. I think we should keep you company, at least while you're still here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: VIP or not VIP, special or not special... That doesn't matter at all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...unless there's money to earn, of course!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then that's exactly what we're after!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That means we're on the right track then. You'll be getting your memories back in no time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think, Rover? Are you in a hurry to recover your memories?

Options.PlotLineKey: The loss of memory doesn't bother me.
I don't know what to do.
What really matters is how I'll live my life and create new memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about meeting with the Magistrate first? She may have the answers you're looking for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are not allowed to go with you. Chixia and I will be right outside the City Hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll be waiting for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right, we're not going anywhere! Just give us a shout if anything goes downâ€”Wait, no, we won't be able to hear ya. Plus they've got this rule about not yelling inside the City Hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A crowd has gathered outside City Hall. They are all eager to meet Jinhsi, but each is turned away by her bodyguard, Sanhua. With questions swirling in your mind, you bide your time and hope for answers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Receptionist
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, follow me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Receptionist
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Kindly have a seat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Receptionist
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Sanhua will be with you shortly.
Pleased to make your acquaintance. I apologize for the delay. My name is Sanhua, the bodyguard of Madam Magistrate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I regret to inform you that Madam Magistrate is currently away. Prior to her departure, she instructed me to bring you these tokens and a welcome gift.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sanhua instantly recognizes you as the guest Jinhsi is expecting. She informs you that Jinhsi is currently away but has left a welcome gift and some mysterious tokens for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate advised you to explore what these tokens represent during her absence. This may help you acquire the information you desire sooner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I apologize for the inconvenience, but please rest assured: she will be here to meet you in three days' time.

Options.PlotLineKey: How am I supposed to know what the tokens represent?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry... I cannot disclose her whereabouts at this time. Please trust me that she is eagerly looking forward to meeting you in person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pardon my inability to provide a better answer. Madam Magistrate has a task that she must handle alone, but she has never for one moment forgotten about her meeting with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not knowing exactly when you'd arrive, she had to leave without having the chance to welcome you in person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because she will require at least three days to complete her current task.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate wanted to assure you that in three days, by any means, she will return to meet you in person.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is there anything I can do to help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be sure to convey your kindness to Madam Magistrate. Please accept my sincerest gratitude.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, Madam Magistrate does hope to have your assistance, but there is no rush for a decision. She does not want to pressure you into anything you may not desire. We invite you to learn about our situation before making a final commitment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When it comes to these tokens, it is never her intention to confuse you with the puzzles. Instead, they should serve as clues that lead you toward the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate deeply regrets not having the time to deliver her messages to you in person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We value your presence far more than you might imagine. The same goes for any and all information about you.

Options.PlotLineKey: How were you certain I was the guest?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since Madam Magistrate is currently away, I cannot make the final confirmation on her behalf.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you. You are truly exceptional.

Options.PlotLineKey: I heard many people were "politely" asked to leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Regarding that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My eyes can see the frequencies of all living beings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or rather, those "frequencies" are the only thing I can see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... You share the same frequency with Madam Magistrate.

Options.PlotLineKey: What does my frequency look like?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You look undistorted and authentic, in your original form.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apologies. My description was not accurate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Both you and Madam Magistrate look undistorted to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In my eyes, you appear the way you are.

Options.PlotLineKey: What do the frequencies of others look like?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They all look different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For some reason, you can tell Sanhua doesn't want to continue this topic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sanhua tells you that Jinhsi will meet you in three days time. When asked why she is certain you are the guest Jinhsi awaits, Sanhua replies that she can perceive frequencies, and yours, like Jinhsi's, is pure and untainted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May I have your Terminal for a moment?

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you want with it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need your Terminal for Access Pass authorization. In the meantime, I will configure the latest Utility modules for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, it's the "gourd" on your waist. The device every Resonator carries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. It was an oversight on my end. I will now import my contact information and that of all public services, like Patrol Stations, into your Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will be here on standby, ready to assist whenever you need me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need your Terminal for regional access authorization. I will also configure the latest Utility module for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate thought you might need it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You waited for a moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Utility module on your Terminal has been upgraded to the latest iteration. Now all the Utilities, including Sensor, Levitator, and Grapple, should be fully functional.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are now granted unlimited access to all regions in Jinzhou. I have sent your Terminal ID to every border pass and Resonance Beacon. You will only need to display your Terminal ID, or activate a Beacon with your Terminal for entry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are free to visit any part of Jinzhou.

Options.PlotLineKey: And that includes the City Hall?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, including the City Hall. You have full access to its facilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also, may I ask... Have you decided your place of residence in Jinzhou?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If not, Madam Magistrate has arranged accommodation for you in advance, here in the City Hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will lead you to your room if you need.

Options.PlotLineKey: That won't be necessary at the moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will lead you to your room if you need.

Options.PlotLineKey: That won't be necessary at the moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. We will be ready to accommodate you anytime.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sanhua upgrades your Terminal. You now have permission to travel to any region of Jinzhou without hindrance.

Chapters.Title: Leave the City Hall and talk to Yangyang

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It took you so long. What gives? Was our Magistrate a chatterbox?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You told Chixia and Yangyang about your conversation with Sanhua.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Madam Magistrate's not in the City Hall...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The wind is rising. In it, I sense disturbance and unrest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha. It sure is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Chixia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The increasing Tacet Fields, uncannily powerful Tacet Discords, and now, our Magistrate's absence...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plus... The mysterious Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm afraid...

Options.PlotLineKey: Before that, what should we get for dinner?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, we've reported to the City Hall, the Ministry of War, AND the Academy. We've done everything we can.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I mean, this is Huanglong! And we're talking about Jinzhou, of all places! We've been through our fair share of unrest over the past thousand years, and we've made it together every time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's been TD outbreaks every year, but we can always trust General Jiyan, Madam Magistrate, and our Sentinel to have our backs! We're not ones to mess with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "United we stand, a bastion of might; one equals a legion, invulnerable in fight"... Well said, Chixia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! We've reported to the City Hall, the Ministry of War, AND the Academy. We've done everything we can so far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I mean, this is Huanglong! And we're talking about Jinzhou of all places. It's never actually been safe here over the past thousands of years. We made it through all those TD outbreaks anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can always trust General Jiyan, Madam Magistrate, and our Sentinel to have our backs! We're not ones to mess with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well said.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aren't you the practical type!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd love me some Chili Sauce Tofu, Jinzhou Maocai, Spicy Meat Slices... Ugh, I'm starving. Wait a sec, we still need to meet up with Baizhi first, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Madam Magistrate is meeting you in three days, and she left these tokens for you, said you can look into what they represent while she is away...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have any plans, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't think there's much for me to do.
That's a three-day vacation in my books.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fair point. A three-day vacation it is!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's just go chill out then! We'll figure out the tokens when we have the chance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ooh, reminds me of the tokens of love in those stories... It sounds like you're off to a secret date or something. What is our Magistrate planning to do with these token puzzles?

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe she is looking for a soulmate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A soulmate? Hmm...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Madam Magistrate left some hidden clues in her tokens. Clues that only the right person would be able to decipher...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Rover has lost all memories, and would likely forget any kind of decryption method they agreed on. It doesn't quite make sense. Or maybe... She is trying to make Rover notice something else?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, do you mind if we have a look at the tokens?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You showed Yangyang and Chixia the tokens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what's so special about them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A candy? Oh! I've had these when I was a kid. I think they were called... Sugar pearls?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I haven't seen anything like this in a while... Went out of trend maybe?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It reminds me of my childhood. I still remember the taste. It was so sweet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was really scared of getting my flu shots when I was little, and sometimes the nurse lady would hand out candies like this as a prize for being good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... What does it mean as a token?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems like... a miniature sundial.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is a horological device that tells time by using sunlight's direction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sundials in Huanglong usually have marked lines for the twelve <ano=Time Periods>Shichens</ano> in a day, and every Shichen is 2 hours long, with some showing seasons or months. The design of this sundial looks a bit unusual, though...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On this sundial... Time seems to be represented by the twelve Earthly Branches, drawn on the outer ring of its surface.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And its inner ring shows the "Four Symbols", each representing one cardinal direction. These are the four famous auspicious beasts in Huanglong's folklore. They are believed to protect people from all four directions under heaven.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Generally, The Teal Loong represents the East, the White Tiger stands for the West, the Vermilion Bird stands for the South, and finally, we have the Black Tortoise for the North.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems this sundial is supposed to show both time and direction, but how could it work when there is not a compass attached? Not to mention the lack of sunlight basically renders it useless...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh. That requires way too much brain power...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The color of this leaf seems a bit odd. Can't tell what tree it is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think... I can feel something from it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Nevermind. It's too faint. Maybe it was just my imagination...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry. I can't tell what kind of tree this leaf belongs to, either.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is... A mangosteen fruit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mangosteens are not native to Jinzhou. They are usually imported by boat. I think we can find more mangosteens being sold at the nearby markets.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're not always available for purchase, though. The frequent Tacet Discord Outbreaks can disrupt transportation and cause shortages. The Midnight Rangers have greatly improved the situation in recent years, but still.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Chixia and I share similar childhood memories of the sugar pearl... Do you remember it too, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: It does look a bit familiar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When it comes to candies, no one knows them better than the kids of Jinzhou!

Options.PlotLineKey: We should go find Baizhi first.
We should visit the Academy first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh right, Baizhi's still waiting for us at the Academy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Chixia and Yangyang that Jinhsi will meet you in three days and show them the tokens. They recognize the candy, but cannot recall its significance. After deliberation, the three of you decide to seek answers from Baizhi at the Academy.

Chapters.Title: (Optional) Ask the Kids about the Sugar Pearl

Options.PlotLineKey: Have you seen this candy before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You showed the little girl your sugar pearl, and asked if she had seen it before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The little girl shook her head timidly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After a tense moment of silence, the little girl seems to have finally made up her mind about a great sacrifice. She offers you her hand, revealing a small piece of candy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I don't have candy like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I've got this. It's really good. You, erm, you can have one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate said we should be nice to every guest!

Dialogues.Speaker: Child
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need to thank me! P-please have fun in Jinzhou!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You ask a little girl if she has seen the candy before, with no luck. To welcome you to Jinzhou, however, the little girl gives you a candy of her own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I asked around. None of them has ever seen anything like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe these sugar pearls were only available during a specific time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, would you look at that? Didn't know you were so good with kids!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, would you look at that? Didn't know you were so good with kids!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what's next? More token research?

Options.PlotLineKey: We should go find Baizhi first.
We should visit the Academy first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh right, Baizhi's still waiting for us at the Academy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your investigation yields little leads. The three of you head for the Academy to find Baizhi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, wait a sec, someone's looking for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah... What! When did he disappear? Don't worry. It's alright. I'll be right there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Duty calls! Oops, almost forgot. Can't be late!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, Rover, Yangyang, I've gotta head off for my shift. I'll join you right after I'm done, alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you need me, just shout my name, and I, the Jinzhou Speedster, will be there in a sec.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, you only need to send me a Terminal message as you shout! Then I'll be there in a jiffy. Hehe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: STOP! STOP! Don't call me that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I've gotta go. You guys okay on your own? Give me a heads-up when there's any updates!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, go do your thing. Don't worry, I'm staying with {Male=him;Female=her}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, let's go inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you approach the Academy, Chixia's Terminal suddenly rings. She rushes off, leaving you and Yangyang to enter the Academy alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thereâ€™s still some distance to the Huaxu Academy. Letâ€™s see who reaches there faster!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just installed some apps for you. Please try looking for one thatâ€™s called Utility on the Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See? Just open the Utilities, select the Grapple, and there you go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you wanna be a hero like the Jinzhou Speedster, you gotta master the Grapple! C'mon, give it a shot, Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Baizhi hasn't replied to my message. She's probably busy in her lab.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there must be Mr. Mortefi from the Department of Safety. Baizhi once mentioned him before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He might be able to help us get in touch with Baizhi, but, erm... it seems we've caught him at a bad time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway... Let's try asking him, shall we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...What. You need something?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I refuse to tolerate the foolish striving of those insatiable slugs. Since it's difficult for our researchers to deal with a man like him, I'd rather handle it personally and swiftly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...And you are?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The researcher with glasses appears momentarily unsettled, the flames dimming slightly as he averts his gaze. He tries to conceal his surprise, but it is evident in his eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...My apologies. Did I startle you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Mortefi, please pardon our intrusion. We are friends of Baizhi, and we're here to look for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. I hope I didn't cause any offense earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not at all, it was us who bothered you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Baizhi should be in the Data Analysis Room. I'll go tell her you're here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, sir.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You cross paths with a researcher named Mortefi. After learning the purpose of your visit, he leaves to inform Baizhi of your arrival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is Mortefi, a renowned figure in the Department of Safety. He was born in the New Federation, and he joined the Huaxu Academy a few years ago. I heard his talent is truly impressive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People say he is a bit scary at first glance, but he's actually quite kindhearted once you get to know him...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chixia told me he's quite popular with the kids. Children have been pestering him for all kinds of fancy toys, and he's always open to their requests.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here you are. The data we collected in the Gorges of Spirits has been submitted for analysis, and we'll have the results today. I have the equipment for your physical examinations ready, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Any discoveries during your trip to the City Hall?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You show Baizhi the tokens and tell her about what happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think, Baizhi?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a hypothesis about the sugar pearl, but I need to verify it first. If possible, I recommend conducting non-destructive tests of all these tokens you have.

Options.PlotLineKey: Wish I could have thought of it earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Data is always straightforward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The first three tokens can be tested at <ano=Branch of Remnant Studies>my branch's laboratory</ano>. This miniature sundial will require radiographic testing, though. To access the necessary equipment, we'll need to file a request with one of the Tacetite studies related branches.

Options.PlotLineKey: Tacetite... That's the field Mortefi specializes in, isn't it?
We can ask them about the other tokens too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, Mortefi is the Branch of Tacetite Weaponry's head within the Department of Safety.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One moment, please.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Soon after, Baizhi returns with Mortefi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Give me the items to be tested. Anything else you need me to know, you can let me know now. You may retrieve your items in twenty minutes, and the analysis report will be ready five minutes after that. Take a right, and you'll find me in the testing room.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mortefi takes the sundial and gently weighs it in his hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one looks like the early handiwork of someone I know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's lightweight, and its design differs from that of the typical sundial. And it appears to be missing a part. See, there's a groove here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't see anything special with these items. Speaking of this sugar pearl... So you all remember eating sugar pearls like this when you were kids? I don't think I've ever had anything like this in my childhood.

Options.PlotLineKey: Mr. Mortefi, I heard you weren't raised in Huanglong?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. I'm from the New Federation. You mean this sugar pearl might be unique to Huanglong?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember a nurse lady giving me a candy like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, sugar pearls like this were distributed at hospitals? Perhaps...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sugar pearl might be a type of medicine. Its sweet taste would've made it more palatable to children.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ms. Baizhi. As a Huanglong local working at the Academy, I suppose you already had an idea about what it is?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do have my theory as to what it is, but it still needs verification. I wouldn't proclaim any solid answers before confirming the chemical composition of this item with reliable data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seconded. Let's find out through actual testing, then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It will take some time before the results are ready. If you have other matters to take care of, you should go ahead. I'll let you know once we have the results.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shall we wait here at the Academy, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: We'll take a quick look around here, then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure you can, but don't forget your physical examinationâ€”I'll see you in a while for that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Baizhi suggests running a full analysis on the Sugar Pearl and sundial to uncover more information. Before parting, she encourages you to have a medical examination when time allows.
Greetings. I was told that you were the ones that helped find Mister Zongye. Please accept my deepest gratitude.
I've prepared a fresh pot of tea, how about I pour some for you while you rest up in the teahouse for the time being?
*Chuckle* Where are my manners. I am Yuanwu. It's a pleasure to meet you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm Chixia!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Yangyang... Master Yuanwu?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yuanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know of me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Teahouse Assistant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa! Careful Mister Zongye! Really hot pot of tea in my hands!

Dialogues.Speaker: Teahouse Assistant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No! My tea!
Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow that was fast!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such calm Streams...

Dialogues.Speaker: Teahouse Assistant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh dear! Thank the heavens you saved it in time, Jianxin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here's your tea. Off to the customers you go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mister Zongye, you're back! Are you hurt?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zongye
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Chuckle* Oh, it's you Jianxin, you silly girl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: H-how's Mister Zongye able to recognize you? Weird!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jianxin, disciple in training. We've met before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jianxin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you the one's that brought back Mister Zongye? Thanks so much!

Chapters.Title: Talk to Baizhi for your body check-up

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have the equipment ready. I'll need to check your health status and see if there are any unusual fluctuations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, let's begin if you're ready.

Options.PlotLineKey: One moment please. Can I ask about...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have any questions before we begin?

Options.PlotLineKey: Do I have to do this?
Have you ever come across other similar cases?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Based on the samples collected, the Tacet Discord you defeated was at least an Overlord Class. After defeating it, you seemingly absorbed its frequency energy with your bare hands.

Options.PlotLineKey: Will there be any kind of side effects?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords are classified according to the concentration levels of their characteristic frequencies. Generally, Tacet Discords with higher concentration levels are considered to pose greater threats.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The current classification levels, from lowest to highest, are Common, Elite, Overlord, and Calamity. Additionally, there is a special type of Tacet Discord, and we call them the Threnodians.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have absorbed a very powerful Echo with your body. You may seem fine now, but there could be internal changes that are too subtle to see or detect with my Resonance Ability.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Based on all the records I can find, humans need a Pangu Terminal in order to record or replicate an Echo's frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I am quite curious how you could do that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When a Tacet Discord is eliminated, its frequency energy may linger in the form of an incorporeal manifestation, which is known as a "Reverberation".

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Resonator's Terminal collects and records said Reverberations, turning them into "Echoes" that can be directed as desired.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The combat abilities of these Echoes can then be replicated through the Terminal's Data Bank module, enabling Resonators to use them in battles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Additionally, some Echoes' abilities allow Resonators to briefly transform into their shapes.

Options.PlotLineKey: So you can turn into an "Echo"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, to some extent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apart from the ancient legend Yangyang mentioned earlier, I've never heard of anything like this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if we look at it another way, we might finally be able to verify said legend once we figure out what really happened with your body.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you try to manifest the Crownless' frequency without using your Terminal?

Options.PlotLineKey: Sorry. It seems I can't do that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I am not seeing the Crownless' data in your Terminal. So it was indeed absorbed into your body...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Crownless' frequency energy was "consumed" by your body, leaving no trace behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But how did you manage to do that? It's as though there's another mechanism within your body capable of absorbing frequency energy...

Options.PlotLineKey: Will I turn into a monster?
What kind of impact will it have on me?
Does this have anything to do with my amnesia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do you define "monster"? For Resonators like you, such abnormal fluctuations in frequency typically lead to Overclocking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When a Resonator's mental capacity is overwhelmed, they may lose control of their <ano=power>Forte</ano>, causing an overflow of Resonance energy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is known as "Overclocking" and is categorized into three levels based on severity. The excess Resonance energy harms both the Resonator and their surroundings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In extreme cases, the excess energy can even manifest as destructive Tacet Fields.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have established a comprehensive Overclock diagnosis process to accurately predict potential risks of Overclocking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your waveform graph shows a remarkable level of stability, surpassing any Resonator I've encountered. Your risk of Overclocking should be minimal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't need to worry about that for the time being.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't say without sufficient data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your test results don't indicate any trauma, so your amnesia may not be linked to traumatic events.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for your ability to absorb Echoes, I can't make a connection between that and your amnesia based on the current data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To put it simply, it seems there is another dimension or... a creature, hiding inside your body.

Options.PlotLineKey: Sounds like a cool terrarium idea.
Sounds like I have a little universe within me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used that as a metaphor to express my speculation. If such a thing existed within you, scientists would be eagerly seeking to understand it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are so many mysteries about you worth exploring.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A universe. That's a poetic and intriguing comparison.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems we need a simulated combat to figure out what happened in your body.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please hold your Terminal tight and stay still.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see Baizhi for the examination. Before she begins, she shares key insights about Echoes, Resonators, Threnodians, and your place in all this.

Chapters.Title: Talk to Baizhi for your body check-up

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you give us some more details?

Options.PlotLineKey: A giant Tacet Discord with a scythe...
An enormous moon fading in and out of the sky...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A giant Tacet Discord with a scythe... It doesn't sound like the Crownless. Might be even higher-ranked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An enormous moon looming above you... Now, this reminds me of the unusual sightings that supposedly happened during a past war...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the first time we've run into anything like this since we put the training ground into use...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sonoro Sphere captures everything that once happened in a specific time and place, be it good or bad.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We built this simulated training ground after the structure of Sonoro Spheres.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our goal was to extract pure Remnant Energy with the simulated Sonoro Sphere, but we cannot guarantee that all "abnormal frequencies" were eliminated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your arrival may have revived the "abnormal frequencies" we accidentally captured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remnant Energy sometimes give rise to memory manifestations of sentient beings. You may have encountered one such manifestation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suspect it could have something to do with your unconscious mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such anomalies could have been hiding in the simulation, and they 'resonated' with your subconscious. Or perhaps... they were lifted from your subconscious in the first place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm afraid I can't give you a conclusion yet. Not until we've run a thorough analysis on the data collected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll also check the simulated Sonoro Sphere again to see what on earth happened to it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In terms of bodily functions, you seem to be in perfect health... In fact, all the data look quite good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if you feel anything unusual, please come find me any time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Baizhi listens to your account but remains unsure of the cause. She needs more data before drawing any conclusions. The good news? Every test shows you are in perfect health.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here's your sundial. Intact as it was.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Mortefi, can we have the test results?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Simply put, it's hollow. Here, try tapping on it. It sounds different from a solid object.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not just a timekeeping tool; it's an intricate mortise-and-tenon puzzle box.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This sundial is hollow with an inner compartment. We've scanned it, and there is a small paper scroll inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, it's missing a crucial component.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should be able to spin the wheels on this sundial once the right component is installed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Automata Mechanics isn't my field of study. I specialize in developing Tacetite Weapons, but the foundational theories behind these applied technologies are quite similar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have some basic knowledge, but there is someone else who is more knowledgeable in Automata Mechanics than I am.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It wouldn't have taken me this long if we were dealing with Tacetite Weapons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Install the missing part, then rotate the wheels to their correct positions, and you should be able to solve the puzzle and access the paper scroll.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, I still have no idea what the missing component should look like.

Options.PlotLineKey: Shall we go ask the experts in this field?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well that's a no-brainer indeed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can certainly give it a try. If you're fine with the paper scroll being destroyed by its protective mechanism, that is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need to ask him. I can help you with this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just need some time to think it over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One moment. I have an incoming call.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You certainly are well-informed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's indeed beautiful data... Good taste. Well, since you've put it that way...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover... Mr. Mortefi's expression seems to have softened, don't you think?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yeah, he looks like a purring cat now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...an amiable person, isn't he?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We haven't even asked him to help us with assembling...

Options.PlotLineKey: ...and he's already started working on it.
...and he just naturally lent us a hand.
I guess the Academy people are just passionate about solving problems.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It looks like Mr. Mortefi needs some more time. Maybe we should give him some space to concentrate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, let's come back later, shall we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mortefi has cracked the sundial's secrets. He explains what it looks like inside and how it works, but is interrupted by a call. You and Yangyang decide to explore the room until he is free.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I mentally prepared myself for the worst, but this place looks... much better than Mr. Mortefi's description, I think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though it is a bit hard to figure out where we should start...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, of course. I've already noticed all that you mentioned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. You just pointed out a blind spot in my thinking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your workshop? That hellish place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... Stop sweet-talking me. I get it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry for keeping you waiting. Let's get back to the sundial.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a mortise-and-tenon based puzzle box. The missing component in the middle needs to fulfill two entirely different structural requirements at the same time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Considering its entire structure, this component needs an automatic buckle that goes down on top of an embedded pointer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll draw up a design for you. The parts you'll need can be found in Xiangli's workshop. I've already informed him about it; you'll only need to go fetch the parts in his place. He keeps a boxful of them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Division of labor is more efficient in getting things done. Besides, I would like to avoid stepping foot in Xiangli's workshop ever again. The mere thought of that place brings me migraines.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Mortefi, is it the person you were talking to earlier? ...Mr. Xiangli Yao, I think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. It doesn't take me much effort to figure out this little sundial here, but I do admit talking with Xiangli made it easier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's the expert in Automata Mechanics I mentioned earlier. The only Principal Investigator we currently have.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is it going to be dangerous?
It doesn't sound like a pleasant place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a minefield of clutter and chaos. A murky swamp within the Academy walls, as vile and perilous as some primeval forest before the Lament. Any civilized human would find it impossible to stand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Considering its dreadful conditions, I can't agree more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How could he choose to work in such terrible condition? It's like willingingly playing a score backwards.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Shall we go and retrieve the parts now, Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mortefi ends the call. The caller was Xiangli Yao, an Automata Mechanic expert and a Principal Investigator at the Academy. Mortefi will draw up a design for you, but he doesn't have the parts to rebuild the item. He needs you to fetch them from Xiangli Yao's workshop.

Chapters.Title: Find the parts in Xiangli Yao's workshop

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I mentally prepared myself for the worst, but this place looks... much better than Mr. Mortefi's description, I think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though it is a bit hard to figure out where we should start...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see a shelf filled with an assortment of research materials and books: Feasibility Report on Cooking Tacet Discords, Court of Savantae Mysteries, Mortise and Tenon Joints in Huanglong Architecture... Also resting on the shelf are various pieces of wood and copper, some crudely made and others carefully crafted. You can't tell what those are for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shelf creaks under your hand. You try to steady it, but it is too late. A wooden block falls squarely onto your foot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a critical hit!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ro-Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A well-used photo album rests on the table, its cover slightly curved from frequent leafing through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A single photograph lies inside, seemingly cut from a newspaper. It depicts a woman in a white coat gazing at an infant, her face hidden from view. The paper looks well kept.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, I don't think we'll find what we need here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The unusual device has a complex structure and a groove that can fit an entire arm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's cold to the touch, and as you press your arm into it, you feel something sharp and felt a slight pang of pain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, p-please don't touch that! It's dangerous!

Chapters.Title: Find the parts in Xiangli Yao's workshop

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This should be it. It's quite a boxful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go back and show it to Mr. Mortefi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Mortefi, we found the parts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. Bring it to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The test results are in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mangosteen is just an ordinary fruit. It's suitable for regular consumption. We found nothing unusual about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the purple leaf you presented, I detected subtle fluctuations in Tacet Discord's frequency from two distinct sources, but they were overlapping and difficult to distinguish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is a rare occurrence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The scattered nature of these fluctuations rules out the possibility of them being left behind through contact.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is not an ordinary leaf, but it doesn't seem to be a Tacet Discord, either. Based on the data we gathered, I believe it was sampled from an area struck with the Waveworn phenomena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The anomalies that occurred after the Lament, including the formation of Tacet Fields, Etheric Sea, Retroact Rain, and gravity loss... These are collectively called the Waveworn phenomena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the Lament was the start of it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the sugar pearl... It has been determined to be a type of oral vaccine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This sugar pearl expired over 20 years ago. The low-temperature storage life for this vaccine is about 2 years.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A 20-year-old vaccine...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could it be related to the children's epidemic in Jinzhou two decades ago?

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The archives in the Academy should have information on the sugar pearl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The archives here are organized in a unique way. You can start by searching the keywords at the lobby terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Mortefi?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The missing pointer has been installed, and now the sundial should be complete.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the discs are rotatable now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Align the correct markers with the pointer we just installed, and then you should be able to open it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... Ugh, hold on!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember when I said don't force it open?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Crank that thing another five degrees, and not even Xiangli Yao will be able to save it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Earthly Branches and Four Symbols...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These symbols are related to the Sexagenary Cycle. It's an intricate way of recording time in Huanglong. Nowadays it is mainly reserved for calendars, numerology, and indexing, but it's falling out of daily use.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now what kind of information could it represent...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It's the filing system.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most of Huanglong's libraries and databases still use this method to organize their archives. Namely, the Grand Libraries.

Options.PlotLineKey: So it's like a time-based filing system?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The large data repositories located in Huanglong's major cities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. Languages may evolve, names may change, but time remains constant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mortefi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's an elegant system, indeed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Academy's public archives are organized in this manner, too.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go find the archives about this sugar pearl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You deliver the parts to Mortefi. Meanwhile, Baizhi completes her analysis of the mysterious tokens. The mangosteen is ordinary, the purple leaf shows signs of exposure to Waveworn phenomena, and the Sugar Pearl is a vaccine that expired over 20 years ago. As you piece together Baizhi's findings and the restored sundial's ancient Sexagenary Cycle, a revelation dawns.

Chapters.Title: Investigate where the document is located

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I found it... It's located on the "Wei" shelf.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mao, Chen, Si... Wu, Wei. Rover, it's here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are two photos here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One photo shows a group of researchers led by a woman in her thirties. Everyone looks excited and happy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The other photo shows an infant in diapers, with a slender hand holding a spoon with a sugar pearl in it, directed towards the infant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I remember correctly, Jinzhou was established during a Year of Wei, several cycles ago. The Jinzhou City Hall and Huaxu Academy were built in the same year.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gorges of Spirits Battle sparked Jinzhou's founding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the formidable Tacet Discord described here...  I believe it is the "Crownless".

Chapters.Title: Look for clues about the tokens

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are two photos here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One photo shows a group of researchers led by a woman in her thirties. Everyone looks excited and happy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The other photo shows an infant in diapers, with a slender hand holding a spoon with a sugar pearl in it, directed towards the infant.

Chapters.Title: Look for clues about the tokens

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I remember correctly, Jinzhou was established during a Year of Wei, several cycles ago. The Jinzhou City Hall and Huaxu Academy were built in the same year.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gorges of Spirits Battle sparked Jinzhou's founding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the formidable Tacet Discord described here...  I believe it is the "Crownless".

Chapters.Title: Discuss what you have learned with Yangyang

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, about the sugar pearl...

Options.PlotLineKey: Talk about the founding of Jinzhou.
Talk about the time indicated on the sundial.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Life has never been easy after the Lament, but I still remember that sweetness from my childhood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The battle against that epidemic in Jinzhou was grueling. Once infected, children either died or suffered life-long disabilities, Resonators or not. With Tacet Discords ravaging Jinzhou and severing all communication with other cities, desperation ran high.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Words are not enough to convey how desperate people must have felt. They resorted to self-experimentation with a newly developed vaccine, risking everything for a chance. If they failed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We owe our presence here to those who came before us. It's important to remember their sacrifices.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the sugar pearl points to the information and reports we have just read, what is Madam Magistrate trying to convey?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it related to your past? Or is it...

Options.PlotLineKey: I believe it's about my past.
I'm one of the children that were saved.
Is she implying I'm a hero?
Maybe she's trying to tell us something else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to the reports, the vaccine's creator died three years after its development, with the rest of the team now over fifty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean... You could be that infant shown in the footage?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They should be around your age by now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... but {Male=he;Female=she} doesn't have your golden eyes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you are not from Jinzhou... Maybe the place you came from had a similar situation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With this thought, perhaps, the reports about the sugar pearl are just one part of the clues. The other part telling your past and memories is hidden in the documents on the "Wei" shelf. What do you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A hero...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you saying that the information contained in the sugar pearl doesn't directly point to your identity?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinzhou was the most recent city established in Huanglong. The Mountains of Spirits running from north to south divide Huanglong in two. The capital and the five cities are located in the Inner Huanglong, while Jinzhou is in the Outer Huanglong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Battle of Gorge of Spirits was the catalyst to found Jinzhou. Tacet Discords were born in the Norfall Barrens and their invasion route was originally traceable. However, the emergence of the Crownless changed that route.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Crownless is a Tacet Discord that embodies war itself. The hatred of the fallen warriors and the fear of the survivors are the ingredients for it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the limited information available, some researchers have speculated its connection with the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When it comes to the Threnodian, there is a lot to tell. For now, you can think of it this way: the Threnodian is the most powerful Tacet Discord. The Battle of the Threnodian that happened before was to fend it off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to the reports, the Crownless is very similar to the formidable Tacet Discord we encountered.

Options.PlotLineKey: And it was in the Gorges of Spirits, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our Sentinel, JuÃ©, manifested before us in that battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have the symbol "Wei" now. This should go with the time part.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we can't yet solve the puzzle with this alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe we can figure out the cardinal direction part by looking into the tokens again. It might have something to do with how we got one of the clues.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's a lot of hoops to jump through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think, Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've only seen our Magistrate once at the Appointment Ceremony, so I can't comment on her personality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But her policies have proven effective and greatly benefited us since she took office.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some believe that the remarkably far-sighted and profound decisions were actually devised by Counselor "Changli", due to the young age of the Magistrate.

Options.PlotLineKey: So the Magistrate is good at utilizing talents.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Changli is our Magistrate's advisor and former teacher. She once held a high position in the Central Secretariat, but she requested a transfer to Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've also heard about rumors painting her as a cunning manipulator rather than a loyal servant...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seem to hold Madam Magistrate in high regard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But rumors are just that, rumors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's look back on what we've gathered so far: Our clues point to the sugar pearl as a key in solving the sundial's puzzle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Simply put, one token can lead to multiple targets and one target may hold several pieces of information.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We both had our reason for a meeting: the Magistrate had information to share, while I had questions to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, her tokens contain both what she wants to tell me and what I want to ask her, making it seem like she is complicating matters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Maybe she was running out of time. That's why she could only offer us scraps of the puzzle, instead of actually putting it together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or perhaps she's indeed a master strategist, leaving breadcrumbs for us to follow. The initial clues may simply be a test to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She needed to ensure that those who may come across these tokens without understanding their true meaning would not be able to use them for access.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In other words, there are people who need to be misled, and they may obtain these tokens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It seems there may be hidden dangers lurking in Jinzhou...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it were you, Yangyang, what would you do to make sure the recipient gets what you mean?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I would emphasize my true message by repeating it, again and again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find information about the Sugar Pearl's origin. Jinzhou's past begins to unfold before youâ€”a past that may be intertwined with your own. At the same time, you begin to understand the deeper, more pressing reason behind Jinhsi's cryptic messages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm back. I'm back! Finally done with my patrol. How's it going, Rover? Feeling spry as ever?

Options.PlotLineKey: You make it sound like like I'm old.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Baizhi said {Male=he;Female=she} is in great health, no issue to report.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've made some progress in investigating the tokens, too.

Options.PlotLineKey: How did it go for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing special, a typical patrol. Well, Uncle Zhang's cat climbed a tree, and on its way down, it landed on Uncle Chenpi's Head, causing him to take a tumble. Some dogs kept barking and have been scaring the passers-by, so I went there to calm them down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I received a report about someone going missing. I just logged the case and talked to the person who reported it. You're not the one they're searching for, though. Anyhow, I'll need to visit the person who reported the case tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I also tried searchin' for Rover's terminal number, but the system came up with nothing. The latest record was from today when I took Rover for registration. That's pretty much the update for now.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's quite a lot. You almost put me to sleep.
That's quite a lot. You've got me feeling hungry.
Looks like you had a fruitful day.
Do you want me to come along tomorrow?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the middle of the night. Course you're tired.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the middle of the night. Course you're hungry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You betcha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Are you not gonna investigate the tokens?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh right, I still owe you a meal! The night markets are closed though. Let's grab breakfast at Panhua's Restaurant tomorrow before my shift. Meet you guys there in the morning. Be there or be square!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to hit the hay, obviously. Don't tell me you're planning on some nightly activities?

Options.PlotLineKey: Night is the time to beat up Tacet Discords.
Night is the time to meet up with Jinhsi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then you'll feel right at home with the Midnight Rangers. Or more like the "Midnight Danger".

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? You're hanging out with our Magistrate already? Quit bluffing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stop it! We deserve 8-hour workdays!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have a place to stay, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: Sanhua has prepared a room for me.
I'll be staying at the City Hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Talk about hospitality!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Talk about hospitality! Boy, I wonder what it's like to live in the City Hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I have a vacant guest room in my house, and if you don't mind coming over...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aren't you forgetting something, Yangyang? Rover told us this morning that {Male=he;Female=she} has been offered a stay at the City Hall...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, enough chatter or the sun's gonna come up. Let's get Rover back to the City Hall and we'll leave the rest to tomorrow!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's late at night when Chixia meets up with you again. With the day's discoveries weighing heavy, you decide to rest before tackling tomorrow's challenges.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can't shake the feeling that unseen eyes are tracking your every move. Who is the hunter? And who is the prey?
